author: merklefruit
content: Hi all, I have a dumb question on blobs: is it safe (if so, how safe?) to assume that two blobs with the same `commitment` will have the same blob data?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> yes, it is cryptographically secure. Finding two blobs with the same commitment data would require 2^128 operations and is practically impossible (collision attack). Finding a second set of data matching an already existing commitment is even more difficult (2^256/ second preimage attack)
